content.question: In a certain computer program, two positive integers are added together, resulting in an overflow error. Which of the following best explains why the error occurs?

choices.label: The program attempted to perform an operation that is considered an undecidable problem.
The precision of the result is limited due to the constraints of using a floating-point representation.
The program can only use a fixed number of bits to represent integers; the computed sum is greater than the maximum representable value.
The program cannot represent integers; the integers are converted into decimal approximations, leading to rounding errors.

content.answer: The program can only use a fixed number of bits to represent integers; the computed sum is greater than the maximum representable value.
